title: How to make my teenager daughter responsible - Quora

response.answer_text: By sharing the everyday responsibilities with her? E.g., grocery shopping, setting the dinner table, combing the news journal for a helpful article that all of you can discuss about over a cup of tea/coffee, and so on. By treating her an important member of the family, and asking for her point of view on every house-hold decision that you take? E.g., if buying a new car, what model would she suggest and why? Her model’s features against your model’s features. Her model’s cost vs. your model’s cost. Etc. By sharing your thoughts, fears, joys, and sorrows with her, just like you’d do with a friend? And maybe, at some point of time, she’d also start sharing all those things with you. By trusting her, and respecting her choices? E.g., her dressing sense, her food preference, her friends, her college major, etc. That definitely doesn’t imply that you should turn a blind eye if she’s risking her life, say by trying her hand at drugs. By giving her freedom, at the same time also making her realize where the lines are drawn? E.g., it’s OK if, once in a while, she’s not in the mood to study, but it’s not OK if she’s avoiding her studies altogether and her grades are suffering because of it.

Please think slightly different way.. How can I make your daughter realise her mistakes when she acts irresponsible ? The simple answer is Kids generally understand better when something goes wrong and you try to help them correct it. It stays forever in their minds.  This would also allow them to think freely before acting in future on their own a bit more sensibly. Lessons learnt on their own has greater impact than taught. If you try to make them responsible, some times they rebel and feel their freedom is managed by parents.  They also start looking forward to your guidance before doing every thing, which does not help them. It makes them dependant on you rather developing their own individuality and art of learning. Hope this helps...
